recipeintroduction: Enjoy this gooey cheese and chicken pasta bake for the ultimate weekday family dinner. Serve straight from the dish with a dressed green salad
ingredients: 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion, finely chopped, 1/4 tsp chilli flakes, 2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp caster sugar, 6 tbsp mascarpone, 4 skinless chicken breasts, sliced into strips, 300g penne, 70g mature cheddar, 50g grated mozzarella, 1/2 small bunch of parsley
howto: STEP 1 Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a pan over a medium heat and fry the onion gently for 10-12 mins. Add the garlic and chilli flakes and cook for 1 min. Tip in the tomatoes and sugar and season to taste. Simmer uncovered for 20 mins or until thickened, then stir through the mascarpone.

recipeintroduction: A fun way to serve chicken breasts and keep kids interested - why not get them to help?
ingredients: 40g bag tortilla chip, 4 skinless chicken breasts, 200g tub spic tomato
howto: STEP 1 Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Crush the tortilla chips. Put the chicken breasts on a non-stick baking tray, season, then slash each 3 times with a knife. Spoon 1 tbsp of salsa on top of each, then 1 tbsp soured cream.

recipeintroduction: Try these slow cooker meatballs for a tasty family meal. Turkey mince makes lighter meatballs which kids love. They also freeze well so you can batch cook
ingredients: 1 tbsp rapeseed oil, 1 onion, finelly chopped, 2 carrots, finely diced, 500g carton tomato passata
howto: Heat the slow cooker if necessary. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan and add the onion, carrots, celery and garlic and fry gently for a minute. Pour in the passata, add the parsley and stir, then transfer the lot to the slow cooker.

recipeintroduction: Full of omega-3 fats and providing four of your 5-a-day, this healthy dinner is packed with flavourful ingredients including garlic, chilli, salmon fillets and herbs
howto: Heat the oil in a large non-stick pan and fry the onions for 8-10 mins until softened and golden. Add the spring onions, garlic, chilli and thyme.

recipeintroduction: Serve up this tasty Moroccan roast lamb dish for a low-calorie main that delivers stacks of flavour and three of your 5-a-day
howto: Take the lamb out of the fridge while you chop the onions, squash and celeriac.

recipeintroduction: Slow cook your next lasagne for extra tender mince and this version is low-fat and low-calorie. A healthy family meal to give you comfort on cold nights
howto: Heat the slow cooker if necessary. Heat the oil in a large non-stick pan and fry the onions, celery, carrots and garlic for 5-10 mins, stirring frequently until softened and starting to colour.

recipeintroduction: A comforting vegan one-pot recipe that counts for 3 of your 5-a-day! You can't go wrong with this iron-rich, low-fat, low-calorie supper
howto: Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a wide-based pan with a tight-fitting lid.

recipeintroduction: Use whichever beans you have in the cupboard for this richly spiced beef and chipotle slow cooker chilli. It's a perfect meal to prepare for busy weeknights
howto: Set the slow cooker to low. Heat 1½ tbsp oil in a large, non-stick pan over a high heat and fry the mince for 10-12 mins or until evenly browned.

recipeintroduction: Fill your biscuit tin with tasty homemade treats such as cookies and shortbread. Our biscuit recipes are easy to bake and perfect for enjoying with a cup of tea.
howto: To make the biscuits, put the butter, sugar and vanilla in a bowl and beat with an electric whisk until creamy.
